briefdescription.para: Order of numerical accuracy of the operator.
Req. approximations at and near the boundary.
Req. coeffs. per bndy pt. uni. order accuracy.
Row from the optimizer with the minimum rel. nor.
Row currently processed by the optimizer.
Output array containing the operator and weights.

listitem.para: Print order of accuracy.
Print approximating coefficients for the interior.
Print mimetic weights.
Print mimetic approximations at the boundary.

briefdescription.para: Factory method implementing the CBS Algorithm to build operator.

listitem.para: Compute stencil for the interior cells.
Compute a rational null-space from the first matrix transposed.
Compute preliminary approximation (non-mimetic) on the boundaries.
Compute quadrature weights to impose the mimetic conditions.
Compute real approximation (mimetic) on the boundaries.
Assemble operator.

briefdescription.para: Returns how many coefficients are approximating at the boundary.

simplesect.para: How many coefficients are approximating at the boundary.

briefdescription.para: Returns coefficients for the interior of the grid.

simplesect.para: Coefficients for the interior of the grid.

briefdescription.para: Returns collection of weights as computed by the CRSA.
Returns collection of weights as computed by the CBSA.

simplesect.para: Collection of weights as computed by the CBSA.

briefdescription.para: Return collection of mimetic approximations at the boundary.

simplesect.para: Collection of mimetic approximations at the boundary.

briefdescription.para: Returns the operator as a dense matrix.

simplesect.para: The operator as a dense matrix.

listitem.para: Insert mimetic boundary at the west.
Insert coefficients for the interior of the grid.
Impose center-skew symmetry by permuting the mimetic boundaries.

briefdescription.para: Returns the operator as a dense matrix.

simplesect.para: The operator as a dense matrix.

listitem.para: Insert mimetic boundary at the west.
Insert coefficients for the interior of the grid.
Impose center-skew symmetry by permuting the mimetic boundaries.

briefdescription.para: Returns the operator as a dimensionless dense matrix.

simplesect.para: The operator as a dimensionless dense matrix.

listitem.para: Insert mimetic boundary at the west.
Insert coefficients for the interior of the grid.
Impose center-skew symmetry by permuting the mimetic boundaries.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the stencil approximating the interior of the staggered grid.

listitem.para: Create vector for interior spatial coordinates.
Create Vandermonde matrix (using interior coordinates as generator).
Create order-selector vector.
Solve dense Vandermonde system to attain the interior coefficients.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a rational basis for the null-space of the Vandermonde matrix approximating at the west boundary.

listitem.para: Create generator vector for the first approximation.
Create Vandermonde matrix.
QR-factorize the Vandermonde matrix.
Extract the basis for the null-space from Q matrix.
Scale null-space to make it rational.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the set of preliminary approximations on the boundary neighborhood.

listitem.para: Create generator vector for the first approximation.
Compute the dim_null near-the-boundary columns of the pi matrix.
Create the Vandermonde matrix for this iteration.
New order-selector vector (gets re-written with LAPACK solutions).
Solving TT*rr = ob yields the columns rr of the kk matrix.
Scale the kk matrix to make it a rational basis for null-space.
Extract the last dim_null values of the pre-scaled ob.
Once we posses the bottom elements, we proceed with the scaling.

detaileddescription.para: Compute the set of mimetic weights to impose the mimetic condition.

listitem.para: Construct the $ \mathbf{\Pi}$ matrix.
Use interior stencil to build proper RHS vector $ \mathbf{h} $.
Get weights (as CRSA): $ \mathbf{\Pi}\mathbf{q} = \mathbf{h} $.
If required order is greater than critical order, start the CBSA.
Create $ \mathbf{\Phi} $ matrix from $ \mathbf{\Pi} $.
Prepare constraint vector as in the CBSA: $ \mathbf{\Lambda}$.
Brute force search through all the rows of the $\Phi$ matrix.
Apply solution found from brute force search.

detaileddescription.para: Compute mimetic stencil approximating at boundary.

listitem.para: Collect lambda values.
Compute alpha values.
Compute the mimetic boundary approximations.

detaileddescription.para: Construct the output array with the operator and its weights.

listitem.para: The first entry of the array will contain the order of accuracy.
The second entry of the array will contain the collection of approximating coefficients for the interior of the grid.
The third entry will contain the collection of weights.
The next dim_null + 1 entries will contain the collections of approximating coefficients for the west boundary of the grid.

detaileddescription.para: This class implements a 1D gradient operator, constructed using the Castillo-Blomgren-Sanchez (CBS) Algorithm (CBSA).
